item.title: Maximum Likelihood Estimation and the Newton-Raphson method
item.description: The Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE) is probably one of the most well-known methods for estimating the parameters of a particular statistical model, given the data. It aims at finding the parameter values that makes the observed data most likely under the assumed statistical model. Let \(X_1, ... X_n\) be independent and identically distributed random variables.
